main event: A round red object was observed in Newport, Oregon, on 16 November 1956.
interesting points: The object was about the size of a pillow at arm's length and had a tail like a comet,The object was first seen in a reflection in the lake before moving straight up and then 90 degrees to the Northwest,The sighting lasted for one hour until the object slowly faded from view,The sighting was documented by both civilian and military sources,The conclusion of the sighting indicated the object was possibly Mars, visible in the west.
witness description: the object was seen visually and reflected in the lake
